summary: This is an email chain from April 2023 between a US Attorney's Office (USANYS) representative and an FBI Special Agent, forwarding a request from an attorney representing Richard Kahn, a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The attorney seeks access to a specific HP computer seized from Epstein's Little St. James property in the US Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Co-executor of the estate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is represented by an attorney from Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP who is requesting access to a computer seized from Epstein's property. He is identified as one of two co-executors of Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased individual whose estate is being administered
persons.context: The subject of the email chain is his estate. A computer was seized from his property on Little St. James island.

connections.description: Kahn is a co-executor of Epstein's estate, indicating a formal fiduciary and administrative relationship established after Epstein's death.

events.title: Request for Access to Seized Computer
events.description: An attorney representing Richard Kahn, co-executor of Epstein's estate, formally requests access to a specific HP Slim Tower computer seized from the 'generator room' on Little St. James island during a USVI search.

events.title: USVI Property Search
events.description: A search was conducted at Jeffrey Epstein's properties on Little St. James in the US Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of multiple devices, including more than one HP computer.

locations: Little St. James (island, US Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: In April 2023, attorneys for Epstein's estate were actively seeking access to evidence (a specific computer) seized by law enforcement from his USVI property.
Richard Kahn is identified as one of two co-executors managing Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
A search of Epstein's Little St. James property yielded multiple seized devices, including HP computers.
The requested computer was an HP Slim Tower located in a 'generator room' on Little St. James.
The communication shows ongoing posthumous legal and investigative activity related to Epstein's estate and seized evidence years after his death.
